le brian howell

About

I am currently a PhD candidate in the Multi-physics Simulation and Optimization Laboratory at UC Berkeley where I specialize in numerical optimization for materials design. Generally, I am interested high performance computing for applied math/physics, finance and machine learning. More than anything, I enjoy chasing flow states powered by light-roast espresso.

Previously, I worked as a staff scientist at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory where I worked on simulation, optimization, hardware and chemical formulation for 3d printing, and at Google X where I worked as an AI resident in materials optimization.

Here are some logs of my musings and travels:

  • Travels
